availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Pendleton County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Matilda Webster McKinley in Pendleton County, Kentucky, in December 1837. Father of Jesse McKinley, Martha E. McKinley, and Mary J. McKinley, Married to Matilda A. Stevenson McKinley in Grant County on April 3, 1853. Father of Nancy A. McKinley, Melvina McKinley, Benjamin McKinley, and Annie McKinley. Farmer in Pendleton County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, p. 542.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grant County, Flat Creek, p. 550B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, 1783-1965, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Pendleton County Marriages, 1822-1877, Film #000272800, p. 257, p. 124 of 660 of microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1852-1910), KDLA, Film # 994035: Grant County Marriages, 1853, p. 3 of 13 of microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Find A Grave, “Josiah McKinley (1830-1881)," Memorial # 8738339, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/8738339/josiah-mckinley (accessed March 17, 2021).
